titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Great Britian Admiralty Account Book, 1661-1692 MS 229

publicationstmt.publisher: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

note.p: Stored onsite at the Woodson Research Center.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-04-01 19:22:33 -0500.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

did.abstract: The account book includes individual wages for officers and crews; allowances for victuals; prices of provisions to be paid to and by the Purser; various allowances and expense lists; lists of French, Dutch and Algiers fleets, including ship names and guns; as well as lists of the major Royal Navy commands, the red, white, and blue squadrons, with ships assigned to each, their commanders, guns, and names of flag officers commanding.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Originally controlled the office of Lord High Admiral, King Charles I put the office in commission in 1623 and the Board of the Admiralty took charge of the Royal Navy by the 18th century. The Admiralty of Great Britain was the authority in the United Kingdom for the command of the Royal Navy until 1964, when the Ministry of Defence took over as the head of all military affairs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The account book includes individual wages for officers and crews; allowances for victuals; prices of provisions to be paid to and by the Purser; various allowances and expense lists; lists of French, Dutch and Algiers fleets, including ship names and guns; as well as lists of the major Royal Navy commands, the red, white, and blue squadrons, with ships assigned to each, their commanders, guns, and names of flag officers commanding.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This material is open for research.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Stored onsite at the Woodson Research Center.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This collection is a memorial gift in honor of Mr. and Mrs. Herman Brown, purchased from Francis Edward, dealer.

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Portions of this collection are available online at: https://scholarship.rice.edu/handle/1911/21930

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Great Britain, Admiralty, account book, 1661-1692, MS 229, Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Great Britian Admiralty Account Book must be obtained from the Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University.

did.unittitle: Great Britian Admiralty Account Book, 1 bound volume (9 1/2" x 7 1/2") with two folding tables at the beginning and 4 pp. index at end. 125 pages
